name: Kibbutz Lavi Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at this kibbutz as part of a group tour. I wish I had had more time to explore. With the days full of activities away from the kibbutz, time did not allow me to walk around as I would have enjoyed. Was able to attend a presentation by one of the kibbutz members and it was so informative. All the staff were very nice and did whatever they could to make our stay comfortable. Breakfast and dinner buffets were wonderful. This is a busy kibbutzz, but considering that, the care given to guests was outstanding. The accommodations could be viewed as modest, but kept clean. The lobby was very nice, and there's a unique little shop in lobby area. Beautiful garden available to walk through and relax.
reviews.title: Loved this Kibbutz!
A Beautiful Hotel in a lovely setting
reviews.text: I stayed in the new wing. The hotel and food were very good. The location is beautiful with incredible views from the rooms. the only drawback is that air conditioning through the hotel itself (not the rooms) was minimal at best. Otherwise, it was a fantastic experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a quiet 3 days at the Lavi hotel; a perfect location for touring the north, located between Nazareth and the Sea of Galilee. We have been here before; previously with young children and this time, just the two of us. (We think this is a great place for kids: they can feel comfortable playing outside and venturing out a little on their own.) The quiet and beauty of the kibbutz along with the friendliness of the kibbutz members make for a unique experience that you can't get at a 'city hotel.' On a tour of the kibbutz we saw the cows being milked, the factory that manufactures synagogue furniture (and ships all over the world), the childrens' houses where the young children spend their day while parents are working and we heard a fascinating description of communal life on the kibbutz.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in the Galilee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the process of expanding; our room was simple and quite comfortable, with an incredible view of the countryside. We had breakfast each morning (served by kibbutz members) and enjoyed the huge buffet with fresh cheeses made on the kibbutz. A kibbutz member helped us plan our outings; since we have been here before we especially appreciated suggestions for interesting sites we had never seen before.
reviews.title: Loved Kibbutz Lavi - and can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — its location, the quality of the accomodations and the great food

reviews.text: The Sabbath, on this religious kibbutz, gives you the opportunity to experience Shabbat without automobiles and the commerce of the weekdays. On Saturday afternoon, we took a walk around the kibbutz and visited the kibbutz's beautiful archeological garden with an ancient olive press and other artifacts. We also took advantage of the quiet to rest up from an exhausting week of touring.
reviews.title: Oy- the elevators

reviews.text: A bit yekkish over Shabbat and yom tov. Fine for midweek. The food isn't great but the hotel is close to tiberias and not too far from tsfat.
reviews.title: average

likes.liked: — the dirty sheets on my bed which couldn't be changed till after shabbat when reception started to function again

reviews.text: The hotel is on a religious Kibbutz which means that there are a number of restrictions (eg men and women have to use the swimming pool at different times and on Friday nights the lights in the rooms go out automatically at 11pm).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
kibbutz lavi...
reviews.text: The Kibbutz itself is run on strict communal lines (everyone earns the same and has the same allowance from the community) and it is very interesting to learn about the Kibbutz life.

The Hotel itself has recently been renovated and the common parts are clean and in keeping with a good 3 star hotel. The rooms in the modern annex are worth the extra. Good standard with TV, bath, small balcony and desk.
reviews.title: A diamond in the rough

reviews.text: We loved our stay at this comfortable hotel- complete with breakfast and dinner along with a little Israeli beer. The beds were very comfortable and the amenities were nice. I believe that all the staff live on the kibbutz, and that was an added treat. Everyone was eager to please even if their English was limited. We took a tour through the furniture making factory and were impressed by the high tech operation. Our tour guide was a little brusque, though she was originally from S. Africa and seemed put upon to guide us.
reviews.title: Luxury near the Golan Heights

reviews.text: All in all, this was a memorable stay at a kibbutz. Who knew that a luxury hotel existed in an area that might seem to be somewhat off the beaten track?
reviews.title: What a beautiful quaint place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When i heard that the group was going to stay at a Kibbutz, I imagined that all of us were going to stay in dorms with minimal comfort. To my surprise when the bus brought us to the place, it was nothing of this sort.
reviews.title: Just a bit better than ok.
Nice place to stay 10 min from Tiberias
reviews.text: The front desk is nothing to shout at but the rooms were clean and comfortable. Cable tv, safe, kettle with coffee and tea included, and a nice spacious bathrooms.

My room was on the ground floor and when I went out the back door, it was a garden. The weather in the evening and early morning was nice and warm to just sit down, read a book and have a cup of coffee.
reviews.title: One of the best places to stay in Northern Israel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firts of all i must say that the hotel is divided in two parts, the new and the old one.-
reviews.title: NO COMMENT

reviews.text: Unfortunattely i stayed at the old part, and it was really really old, like a museum, there was a music device that made me laugh because it remainded me my childhood.-
reviews.title: Excellent stay, great food and superb service

reviews.text: The only night i spent there was a night to forget.-
reviews.title: amazing bar mitzvah shabbat on Lavi

reviews.text: This hotel receives groups of young people around 18 to 20 years that don`t know to respect others, so they make noice at the halls. You are in your bed and you listen how they speak and laugh.-
reviews.title: Lovely Kibbutz to hold a simcha

reviews.text: In our case we complained at the front desk and they send them to their rooms and didn`t make noise anymore.-
reviews.title: Wonderful Shabbat Stay

description: Elegant luxury with a relaxed "heimish" kibbutz atmosphere. Tranquil and pastoral, with sports facilities. Shabbat observance. Food abundant and delicious - glatt kasher lemehadrin. Family oriented with in / out door play grounds. Superb views and in-house tourist guide directing to regional attractions and sites. Within easy access to sites and cities in Israel.
